original: Ågren, Olof Casimir, konstnär, Mis-terhult, f. 26/11/74 i Alsen, Jämtl. 1., av fanj. Nils Å. o. Christina Winn-berg. G. 33 m. Elisaibeth Bergström. — Stud. v. konstakad. i Sthlm 98-03, i Berlin o. Paris 08-10, Ital. o. Syd-frankr. 20-27. Tillh. konstn :gruppen Optimisterna, utf. naivistiska stadsmotiv, ’hamnbilder, dekorativa komp. m. m., som inbj. delt. i Carnegiestift. utst. i Pittsburgh 36-37, repr. i bl. a. Nat:-mus., Thüelska gall, Gbgs, Västerås, Östersunds o. Norrköp. mus. Numera lantbr. i Flivik.
translated: Ågren, Olof Casimir, artist, Mis-terhult, b. November 26, 1874 in Alsen, Jämtland county, son of Corporal Nils Å. and Christina Winnberg. Married in 1933 to Elisaibeth Bergström. — Studied at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Stockholm from 1898 to 1903, in Berlin and Paris from 1908 to 1910, in Italy and southern France from 1920 to 1927. Associated with the art group Optimisterna, known for painting naive cityscapes, harbor scenes, and decorative compositions, among other things, which were invited to participate in exhibitions by the Carnegie Foundation in Pittsburgh from 1936 to 1937, represented in, among other places, the National Museum, Thüelska Gallery in Gothenburg, Västerås, Östersund, and Norrköping museums. Currently engaged in agriculture in Flivik.

structured.name: Olof Casimir Ågren
structured.description: Swedish artist known for painting naive cityscapes, harbor scenes, and decorative compositions
